description: Controlled vocabulary for magnetosensitivity research - Enhanced from literature corpus

radical_pair_mechanism.definition: A proposed mechanism for magnetosensitivity based on spin-correlated radical pairs

chemical_amplification.definition: Enhancement of magnetic field effects through slow radical termination reactions under continuous photoexcitation

singlet_triplet_interconversion.definition: Coherent interconversion between singlet and triplet radical pair states driven by magnetic interactions

intersystem_crossing.definition: Non-radiative transition between electronic states of different spin multiplicity

magnetite_mechanism.definition: Magnetosensitivity based on biogenic magnetite crystals and mechanical torque

cryptochrome.definition: Blue light photoreceptor protein implicated in magnetosensitivity, contains FAD cofactor

photolyase.definition: Flavoprotein closely related to cryptochromes, repairs UV-damaged DNA

flavoprotein.definition: Protein containing flavin cofactor (FAD or FMN), candidate for radical pair mechanism

lysozyme.definition: Model protein used to study intermolecular flavin-tryptophan radical pairs

flavin_adenine_dinucleotide.definition: Flavin cofactor in cryptochromes and flavoproteins, photochemically active

flavin_mononucleotide.definition: Flavin cofactor, smaller analog of FAD

tryptophan.definition: Aromatic amino acid, electron donor in cryptochrome radical pairs

ascorbic_acid.definition: Vitamin C, potential electron donor forming radical pairs with flavins

migratory_birds.definition: Birds that migrate seasonally and use magnetic compass for navigation

drosophila_melanogaster.definition: Fruit fly, model organism for cryptochrome-based magnetosensitivity studies

geomagnetic_field.relevance: Biologically relevant field strength for navigation

hypomagnetic_field.definition: Magnetic field significantly weaker than Earth's field

weak_magnetic_field.definition: Magnetic field below ~1 mT, comparable to or stronger than geomagnetic field

low_field_effect.definition: Characteristic MFE showing positive effect at sub-mT fields with zero crossing around 1-2 mT
low_field_effect.cause: Radical pairs with small hyperfine couplings (e.g., ascorbyl radical)

hyperfine_coupling.definition: Magnetic interaction between electron and nuclear spins, key to radical pair compass

zeeman_interaction.definition: Interaction of electron spin with external magnetic field
zeeman_interaction.importance: Isolates triplet sublevels in strong fields

exchange_coupling.definition: Direct spin-spin interaction between two radicals
exchange_coupling.typical_values: Should be small for magnetic sensing (< 0.1 mT)

fluorescence_spectroscopy.definition: Detection of emitted light following photoexcitation, used to monitor MFEs

transient_absorption_spectroscopy.definition: Time-resolved optical spectroscopy technique for detecting short-lived intermediates

electron_paramagnetic_resonance.definition: Spectroscopic technique for detecting unpaired electrons and measuring magnetic parameters

cavity_ring_down_spectroscopy.definition: High-sensitivity absorption technique using optical cavity

spin_dynamics_simulation.definition: Numerical simulation of spin evolution in radical pairs using density matrix formalism

molecular_dynamics.definition: Computational simulation of molecular motion and protein dynamics

density_functional_theory.definition: Quantum mechanical method for electronic structure calculations

photoexcitation.definition: Absorption of light promoting molecule to excited electronic state

electron_transfer.definition: Movement of electron from donor to acceptor, forming radical pair

radical_termination.definition: Reactions that remove free radicals, returning them to ground states
importance: Controls amplification factor via k_F and k_D

singlet_state.definition: Radical pair state with total spin S = 0, antiparallel spins

triplet_state.definition: Radical pair state with total spin S = 1, parallel spins

spin_selectivity.definition: Differential reactivity of singlet vs triplet radical pair states
spin_selectivity.importance: Required for magnetic field effect on reaction yields
